interface.name: ext_idle_notifier_v1

description.summary: get notified about user idle status

interface.description:
This interface allows clients to monitor user idle status.
After binding the client will receive the current idle status immediately. Future idle status changes will be sent as events.
Warning! The protocol described in this file is currently in the testing phase. Backward compatible changes may be added together with the corresponding interface version bump. Backward incompatible changes can only be done by creating a new major version of the extension.

request.name: destroy
request.description: Destroy the manager object. All objects created via this interface remain valid.

request.name: get_idle_notification
request.description:
Create a new idle notification object.
The notification object has a minimum timeout duration and is tied to a seat. The client will be notified if the seat is inactive for at least the provided timeout. See ext_idle_notification_v1 for more details.
A zero timeout is invalid and must result in a protocol error.

interface.name: ext_idle_notification_v1

description.summary: get notified about user idle status

interface.description:
This interface is used by the compositor to send idle notification events to clients.
Initially the notification object is not idle. The notification object becomes idle when the associated seat has not received any user activity for at least the timeout, starting from the time the get_idle_notification request was received.
Notification objects do not immediately become not-idle just because user activity was received. Instead, an idled notification is sent when the seat has been idle, and a resumed notification is sent when the seat becomes not idle again after being idle.
The compositor must send a resumed event before the first idled event. Compositors may choose when to send the resumed event.

event.name: idled
event.description:
This event is sent when the notification object becomes idle.
It's a compositor error to send this event twice without a resumed event in between.

event.name: resumed
event.description:
This event is sent when the notification object is no longer idle.
It's a compositor error to send this event twice without an idled event in between. The first resumed event may be sent at any time after the notification object is created.
